doc.title: Best Buy Remix REST API v1.0
doc.html:p: Remix is an API that gives you access to BestBuy.com's product catalog data and more.

Note: This WADL is not "official" documentation and is not provided or endorsed by Best Buy. This WADL is a work in progress and makes no claim to completeness. Its purpose is to provide a useful companion to the official documentation for developers who prefer the WADL style.
doc.html:pre:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK X-Lighty-Magnet-Uri-Path: /v1/stores X-Mashery-Responder: mashery-1.cust.iad.llnw.net Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2009 00:37:27 GMT Server: thin 1.0.0 codename Pivotal 2009-1-26 Etag: "faabc3793681624ff719f7d1101c918f" X-Runtime: 32ms Content-Type: text/xml; charset=UTF-8 Cache-Control: private, max-age=0, must-revalidate Vary: Accept-Encoding Accept-Ranges: bytes Content-Length: 4355
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <stores currentPage="1" totalPages="106" from="1" to="10" total="1052" queryTime="0.004" totalTime="0.028" canonicalUrl="/v1/stores?apiKey=<YourApiKey>"> <store> <storeId>1504</storeId> <name>Caguas, PR</name> <address>Las Catalinas Mall</address> <city>Caguas</city> <region>PR</region> <postalCode>00725</postalCode> <fullPostalCode>00725</fullPostalCode> <country>US</country> <lat>18.205647</lat> <lng>-66.034454</lng> <phone>787-258-0110</phone> <hours>10:00am - 9:00pm Monday - Friday, 11:00am - 6:00pm Saturday, 11:00am - 6:00pm Sunday</hours> </store> ... </stores>

doc.html:p: Best Buy store data may be retrieved via requests to the 'stores' resource:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/stores?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
By default, data is returned in XML format. JSON data may be requested via the 'format' query parameter:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/stores?apiKey=<YourApiKey>&format=json
Optionally, this data may be filtered by one or more attribute comparisons:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/stores(city='New York'&region='NY')?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
Several comparison types are supported:

html:ul.html:li:
equal/not equal:
stores(name=Noho Manhattan NY)
stores(state!=NY)
stores(postalCode<>10010)

less/greater numeric:
stores(storeId<100)
stores(lat<=40)
stores(lng>-73)
stores(storeId>=500)

doc.html:p: Additionally, the stores resource supports an area() function.
This function accepts a postal code and a maximum distance to return a list of stores from a given area:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/stores(area(10010,5))?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
Key used to identify a client application to the Remix service
Specifies a response format ('xml' or 'json')
Specifies which page of results to retrieve
Limits the returned data to a list of fields (e.g. show=name,storeId,phone)
Specifies a sort field for result ordering; .desc may be appended for descending order
Indicate the server's acceptance of range requests for a resource
Specifies directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms
Indicates the length (in bytes) of the entity being returned
Indicates the media type of the entity being returned
Represents the date and time at which the message was originated (RFC1123)
Provides the current value of the entity tag for the requested variant
Contains information about the software used by the origin server to handle the request
Indicates the set of request-header fields that fully determines, while the response is fresh, whether a cache is permitted to use the response to reply to a subsequent request without revalidation.
Service header
Service header
Service header
Service header

html:p.html:strong: Retrieve data for a single store (Status 200)

doc.html:p: Data related to a specific Best Buy store may be retrieved via requests to the 'store' resource:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/stores/4.xml?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
By default, data is returned in XML format. JSON data may be requested via the 'format' URI segment:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/stores/4.json?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
Key used to identify a client application to the Remix service
Limits the returned data to a list of fields (e.g. show=name,storeId,phone)
Indicate the server's acceptance of range requests for a resource
Specifies directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms
Indicates the length (in bytes) of the entity being returned
Indicates the media type of the entity being returned
Represents the date and time at which the message was originated (RFC1123)
Provides the current value of the entity tag for the requested variant
Contains information about the software used by the origin server to handle the request
Indicates the set of request-header fields that fully determines, while the response is fresh, whether a cache is permitted to use the response to reply to a subsequent request without revalidation.
Service header
Service header
Service header
Service header
Best Buy product data may be retrieved via requests to the 'products' resource:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/products?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
By default, data is returned in XML format. JSON data may be requested via the 'format' query parameter:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/products?apiKey=<YourApiKey>&format=json
Optionally, this data may be filtered by one or more attribute comparisons:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/products(name='Bat*'&type='Movie')?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
Several comparison types are supported:

html:ul.html:li:
less/greater numeric:
products(salePrice<11.99)
products(salePrice<=11.99)
products(salePrice>11.99)
products(salePrice>=11.99)

doc.html:p: Key used to identify a client application to the Remix service
Specifies a response format ('xml' or 'json')
Specifies which page of results to retrieve
Limits the returned data to a list of fields (e.g. show=name,storeId,phone)
Specifies a sort field for result ordering; .desc may be appended for descending order
Indicate the server's acceptance of range requests for a resource
Specifies directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms
Indicates the length (in bytes) of the entity being returned
Indicates the media type of the entity being returned
Represents the date and time at which the message was originated (RFC1123)
Provides the current value of the entity tag for the requested variant
Contains information about the software used by the origin server to handle the request
Indicates the set of request-header fields that fully determines, while the response is fresh, whether a cache is permitted to use the response to reply to a subsequent request without revalidation.
Service header
Service header
Service header
Service header

html:p.html:strong: Retrieve data for a single product (Status 200)

doc.html:p: Data related to a specific Best Buy product may be retrieved via requests to the 'product' resource:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/products/8982988.xml?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
By default, data is returned in XML format. JSON data may be requested via the 'format' URI segment:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/products/8982988.json?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
Key used to identify a client application to the Remix service
Limits the returned data to a list of fields (e.g. show=sku,name,salePrice)
Indicate the server's acceptance of range requests for a resource
Specifies directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms
Indicates the length (in bytes) of the entity being returned
Indicates the media type of the entity being returned
Represents the date and time at which the message was originated (RFC1123)
Provides the current value of the entity tag for the requested variant
Contains information about the software used by the origin server to handle the request
Indicates the set of request-header fields that fully determines, while the response is fresh, whether a cache is permitted to use the response to reply to a subsequent request without revalidation.
Service header
Service header
Service header
Service header

html:p.html:strong: Retrieve a collection of specific products in specific stores (Status 200)

doc.html:p: Store availability data may be retrieved via requests to a combined 'products+stores' resource:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/stores(area(10010,5))+products(sku=8982988)?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
By default, data is returned in XML format. JSON data may be requested via the 'format' query parameter:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/stores(area(10010,5))+products(sku=8982988)?apiKey=<YourApiKey>&format=json
Data is filtered by one or more attribute comparisons:
http://api.remix.bestbuy.com/v1/stores(area(10010,5))+products(sku=8982988)?apiKey=<YourApiKey>
Several comparison types are supported:

html:ul.html:li:
equal/not equal:
stores(name=Noho Manhattan NY)
stores(state!=NY)
stores(postalCode<>10010)

less/greater numeric:
stores(storeId<100)
stores(lat<=40)
stores(lng>-73)
stores(storeId>=500)

doc.html:p: Key used to identify a client application to the Remix service
Specifies a response format ('xml' or 'json')
Specifies which page of results to retrieve
Limits the returned data to a list of fields (e.g. show=name,storeId,phone)
Specifies a sort field for result ordering; .desc may be appended for descending order
Indicate the server's acceptance of range requests for a resource
Specifies directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms
Indicates the length (in bytes) of the entity being returned
Indicates the media type of the entity being returned
Represents the date and time at which the message was originated (RFC1123)
Provides the current value of the entity tag for the requested variant
Contains information about the software used by the origin server to handle the request
Indicates the set of request-header fields that fully determines, while the response is fresh, whether a cache is permitted to use the response to reply to a subsequent request without revalidation.

<rightViewImage/> <topViewImage/> <color/> <depth/> <dollarSavings>0.0</dollarSavings> <height/> <navigability>true</navigability> <orderable>Available</orderable> <weight/> <shippingWeight>33.6</shippingWeight> <width/> <warrantyLabor/> <warrantyParts/> <longDescription> Make your multimedia dreams come true with PlayStation 3. Featuring a high-definition Blu-ray Disc player, an 80GB HDD, a DUALSHOCK 3 wireless controller and free PlayStation Network membership, you'll be primed to explore new horizons and amazing possibilities. The PlayStation 3 also plays DVDs and CDs, is Internet-ready with built-in Wi-Fi and offers HDMI output for 1080p resolution. With blistering speeds and dazzling graphics, you'll jump-start your world to brand-new levels of excitement.
It all begins with Blu-ray, a next-generation media format that boasts more than five times the storage capacity of traditional DVDs. More storage capacity means a larger canvas to create high-definition, 1080p graphics and a level of interaction never before seen in video gaming. At the heart of the PlayStation 3 is the Cell Broadband Engine. Developed by engineers from Sony, SCEI, IBM and Toshiba, this advanced, state-of-the-art microprocessor features eight Synergistic Processor Units to balance processor workload, making it significantly more powerful than traditional single-core processors. Elevate your gaming experience and do so much more than before. </longDescription> </product>
